title: What are contact center services? - Quora

response.answer_text: The term contact center refers to a centralized workplace dedicated to customer service. Such services are usually offered by a third-party organization. Contact center companies administer incoming and outgoing calls to and from customers. This act helps to resolve sales related queries and gather valuable feedback from your patrons as people expect reliable companies to be consistently available on different platforms.  A contact center is also known as a customer interaction center as it helps a business improve their communication and retain more clients. Most large-scale businesses require professional contact center outsourcing services to form an emotional connection with the masses. Some companies carry out internal operations using the services of a contact center. Contact Center vs Call Center: The two terms are often confused due to their similar services, however; a contact center company offers a wide range of services as compared to a call center. A call center only manages incoming and outgoing calls for a company whereas a contact center provides multiple platforms communication platforms such as emails and social media platforms for customer interaction. This allows companies to create better relations with customers and improve their availability. A contact center often utilizes a customer relationship management (CRM) strategy to analyze customer data and interactions. On the other hand, the call center only focuses on a specific task through a single channel of communication. In a nutshell, contact centers can provide the means for omnichannel support. They revolve around several channels - live chat, email, phone calls, or text messages, just to name a few. In order to create your own contact center and offer a seamless service across the channels, though, you should leverage contact center services: choose a single omnichannel support solution (this way, you don’t need to pay for more than one tool) or pick a few dedicated tools that can be integrated with one another. In both cases, you will be able to keep all the important details in one place and serve your customers in a fast & efficient manner.  Depending on your needs and specificity of your business, you might want to choose between contact and call centers. If your customers prefer calling you - go for a well-functioning call center. In such cases, there’s no need for you to invest in other channels. Powerful call center software like CloudTalk can easily provide you with everything your agents and callers need.If your customers expect you to be present across the channels - you might want to meet these expectations and set up a robust contact center instead. Omnichannel support tools like LiveAgent can work wonders for your business and your customers, especially if you already have a large company and a lot of versatile agents on board.The choice truly depends on the needs of your customers and the specificity of your business. It’s important to realize, however, that both contact centers and call centers can bring you multiple benefits, including the ability to offer outstanding support.
